info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 03 at 2:59PM EST until March 03 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST FOR GORDON AND NORTHWESTERN BARTOW COUNTIES... At 259 PM EST, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located near Plainville, or near Calhoun, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Calhoun, Adairsville, Plainville, Fairmount, Ranger, Sonoraville, Oakman, Redbud and Audubon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
